workflow.name: Track new box office releases with BrowserAct, Google Sheets, OpenRouter and Telegram
workflow.description:
# Track new box office releases from BrowserAct to Google Sheets & Telegram

This workflow acts as an automated movie tracker that monitors box office data, filters out movies you have already seen or tracked, and sends formatted updates to your Telegram. It leverages BrowserAct for scraping and an AI Agent to deduplicate entries against your database and format the content for delivery.

## Target Audience
Movie enthusiasts, cinema news channel administrators, and data analysts tracking entertainment trends.

## How it works
1. **Fetch Data**: The workflow runs on a schedule (e.g., every 15 minutes) to fetch the latest movie data using **BrowserAct**.
2. **Load Context**: It retrieves your existing movie history from **Google Sheets** to identify which titles are already tracked.
3. **AI Processing**: An **AI Agent** (powered by OpenRouter) compares the new list against the existing database to remove duplicates. It then formats the valid new entries, extracting stats like "Opening Weekend" and generating an HTML-formatted Telegram post.
4. **Update Database**: The workflow appends the new movie details (Budget, Cast, Links) to **Google Sheets**.
5. **Notify**: It sends the pre-formatted HTML message directly to your **Telegram** chat.

## How to set up
1. **Configure Credentials**: Connect your **BrowserAct**, **Google Sheets**, **OpenRouter**, and **Telegram** accounts in n8n.
2. **Prepare BrowserAct**: Ensure the **Box Office Trifecta** template is saved in your BrowserAct account.
3. **Setup Google Sheet**: Create a new Google Sheet with the required headers (listed below).
4. **Select Spreadsheet**: Open the **Get row(s) in sheet** and **Append row in sheet** nodes to select your specific spreadsheet.
5. **Configure Notification**: Open the **Send a text message** node and enter your Telegram Chat ID (e.g., `@channelname` or a numeric ID).

## Google Sheet Headers
To use this workflow, create a Google Sheet with the following headers:
* Name
* Budget
* Opening_Weekend
* Gross_Worldwide
* Cast
* Link
* Summary

## Requirements
* **BrowserAct** account with the **Box Office Trifecta** template.
* **Google Sheets** account.
* **OpenRouter** account (or credentials for a compatible LLM like Gemini or Claude).
* **Telegram** Bot Token.

## How to customize the workflow
1. **Adjust Filtering Logic**: Modify the system prompt in the **Scriptwriter** node to change how movies are filtered (e.g., only track movies with a budget over $100M).
2. **Change Output Channel**: Replace the Telegram node with a **Discord** or **Slack** node if you prefer those platforms.
3. **Enrich Data**: Add an **HTTP Request** node to fetch the movie poster image and send it as a photo message instead of just text.

## Need Help?
* [How to Find Your BrowserAct API Key & Workflow ID](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pDjoZWEsZlE)
* [How to Connect n8n to BrowserAct](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RoYMdJaRdcQ)
* [How to Use & Customize BrowserAct Templates](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CPZHFUASncY)

---
### Workflow Guidance and Showcase Video

* #### [Automated Box Office Movie Channel: n8n, IMDb & Telegram üé¨](https://youtu.be/OFuBm6epqdY)

workflow.name: Track new box office releases from BrowserAct to Google Sheets & Telegram

parameters.content:
## ‚ö° Workflow Overview & Setup

**Summary:** This automation scrapes movie box office data using BrowserAct, filters out duplicates against a Google Sheet, and posts new movie updates to Telegram while archiving data.

### Requirements
* **Credentials:** BrowserAct, OpenRouter (Google Gemini), Google Sheets, Telegram.
* **Mandatory:** BrowserAct API (Template: **Box Office Trifecta**)

### How to Use
1. **Credentials:** Set up all required API keys in n8n.
2. **BrowserAct Template:** Ensure you have the **Box Office Trifecta** template saved in your BrowserAct account.
3. **Google Sheet:** Create a sheet named "Movie history" with headers: `Name`, `Budget`, `Opening_Weekend`, `Gross_Worldwide`, `Cast`, `Link`, `Summary`.

### Need Help?
[How to Find Your BrowseAct API Key & Workflow ID](https://docs.browseract.com)
[How to Connect n8n to Browseract](https://docs.browseract.com)
[How to Use & Customize BrowserAct Templates](https://docs.browseract.com)

### üïµÔ∏è Step 1: Scrape & Retrieve

This process triggers a BrowserAct scraper to fetch box office data while simultaneously pulling existing records from Google Sheets for data aggregation.

### üß† Step 2: AI Processing & Filtering

An AI agent compares the new scraped data against the existing database to filter out duplicates. It then parses the raw data into structured JSON (extracting budget, cast, etc.) and generates a formatted HTML message for Telegram.

### üíæ Step 3: Archive & Notify

Valid new movie entries are appended to the Google Sheet archive. Finally, the AI-generated HTML update is posted to the designated Telegram channel.

schema.description: If left blank, the default value defined in BrowserAct will be used.

parameters.text:
=Movies Data :   {{ $('Extract From IMDB Box Office').first().json.output.string }},,
Google sheet Data : {{ $json.data }}

options.systemMessage: You are an advanced Data Processing and Content Generation Agent for a movie tracking workflow. **Your Goal:** Process a raw JSON list of incoming movie data (`input_movies`), filter out duplicates found in the provided database (`existing_movies`), and generate formatted outputs for the remaining new movies. **Inputs provided to you:** 1. `input_movies`: A JSON list of movie objects. 2. `existing_movies`: A list/string of movie names already in the Google Sheet. **Step-by-Step Instructions:** 1. **Deduplication (Filter):** * Compare the "Name" of each movie in `input_movies` against `existing_movies`. * **IF** the name matches (case-insensitive), **DISCARD** it. * **IF** the name is unique, process it as a new movie. 2. **Process New Movies:** For each valid new movie, generate a JSON object with two keys: * **`telegram_message_html`**: Create a post using **Telegram-supported HTML** only (``, ``, ``). * **Header:** The Movie Name in `` bold. * **Genre/Vibe:** An emoji and short description. * **Details:** `` for the Cast list (limit to top 3 names). * **Stats:** "Opening Weekend" value (if available). * **Call to Action:** A clean HTML hyperlink: `üé¨ Watch Trailer / View Details`. * **Tags:** Hashtags at the bottom. * *Constraint:* Ensure all HTML tags are closed properly. Do not use Markdown (`**`). * **`sheet_data`**: Extract clean data for the Google Sheet. * **Parsing:** Extract "Budget", "Opening Weekend", and "Gross Worldwide" from the "BoxOffice" string. Use "N/A" if missing. * **Structure:** Return specific keys: Name, Budget, Opening_Weekend, Gross_Worldwide, Cast, Link, Summary. 3. **Final Output Format:** * Return **ONLY** a single valid JSON array containing the processed objects. * You have 3000 Max char limitation for telegram API. * No conversational text or code block formatting (```json). **Example Output Structure:** [ { "movie_name": "Avatar: Fire and Ash", "telegram_message_html": "Avatar: Fire and Ash üî•\n\nThe Na'vi face a new threat: the Ash People.\n\nCast: Sam Worthington, Zoe Salda√±a, Sigourney Weaver\nOpening: $88,000,000\n\nüé¨ Watch Trailer\n\n#Avatar #NewMovie", "sheet_data": { "Name": "Avatar: Fire and Ash", "Budget": "$400,000,000", "Opening_Weekend": "$88,000,000", "Gross_Worldwide": "$345,000,000", "Cast": "Sam Worthington, Zoe Salda√±a...", "Link": "[https://imdb.com/](https://imdb.com/)...", "Summary": "Jake and Neytiri's family faces new challenges..." } } ]
